HEADING: LINDEN (1877)

	lxxxviii, [1]-64. <em>Copies</em>: BR, US; IDC 6022. – The types of the <em>Plantae columbianae</em> are not
	at BR.
<em>Facsimile ed</em>.: 1977, Leiden (Boerhaave Press), ISBN 90-70153-07-6, 2 new prel. pages plus
	the original [i*, iii*.], [i]-lxxxviii, [1]-64. <em>Copy</em>: FAS. – See Taxon 27: 112-113. 1978.
<em>Ref</em>.: Urban, I., Symb. ant. 3: 78. 1902.
	Sprague, T., Bull. misc. Inf. Kew 1926: 32-44.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: We have seen no further issues of the regular Linden catalogues. We have not
mentioned special catalogues such as trade lists, lists of public auctions of plants, because
these do not contain information of taxonomic or nomenclatural importance.

4628. <em>Lindenia</em> Iconographie des Orchidées. Directeur: J. Linden. Rédacteur en chef:
Lucien Linden &amp; Emile Rodigas. Gand [Gent] 1885-1906, 17 vols. (<em>Lindenia</em>).

<em>Co-editors</em>: Emile Rodigas (1831-1902), Charles Lucien Linden (1853-1940).
<em>Publ</em>.: 17 volumes, each in 12 parts of four plates with accompanying text. In later volumes
	fascicles often came out in sets of 2; the last instalment published, Dec 1906, contained
	parts 9-12 of vol. 17. In all 813 plates, numbered 1-794, 796-814 ofwhich only <em>pl. 525</em> was
	uncoloured. A portrait of Linden is included in vol. 13. <em>Copies</em>: NY, U.
<em>English translation</em>: 13 vols., Feb 1891 – Jul 1898, of 24 plates each, limited to the plates of the
	second half of vol. 6 of the original edition, and vols. 7-12, numbered 265-624. <em>Copy</em>: NY.
	–"Lindenia, iconography of Orchids conducted by J. Linden, Lucien Linden, Em.
	Rodigas and R. A. Rolfe ..." Ghent (printed by Eug. Vanderhaeghen).

Linden, Lucien (1851-1940), Belgian horticulturist, son of J. J. Linden, (<em>L. Linden</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at K.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 656 (b. 1865); BM 3: 1118; IH 2: 446.
Jackson, B. D., Bull. misc. Inf. Kew 1901: 40.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1), Editor of <em>Lindenia</em>, Iconographie des Orchidées (with E. Rodigas),
vols. 1-17, 1855-1903 (NI 2348).
(2). Editor, <em>L'Illustration horticole</em> 28-43, 1881-1896.

4629. <em>Les orchidées exotiques</em> et leur culture en Europe ... Bruxelles (chez l'auteur ...), Paris
(Octave Doin, ...) 1894. Oct. (<em>Orch. exot.</em>)

<em>Co-author</em>: Célestin Alfred Cogniaux (1841-1916).
<em>Publ</em>.: 1894, p. [i]-xiv, [1]-1019. <em>Copy</em>: MO.

Lindenberg, Johann Bernhard Wilhelm (1781-1851) German bryologist, lawyer at
Lübeck, later at Hamburg, ultimately Amtsverwalter (administrator) at Bergedorf. (<em>Lin-
denb</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: The Lindenberg herbarium, over 5000 specimens, is at W. The
types of Gottsche and Lindenberg were at B (now destroyed), isotypes are in Lindenberg's
herbarium in W and also at G (information R. Grolle). Algae at HBG; musci also at STR.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 18: 688-689; Backer p. 330; Barnhart 2: 385; BM 3:
1118; CSP 4: 30; Dryander 2: 237, 244; DTS 1:172; Frank 3(Anh.): 58; Herder p. 261; IH 2:
446; Jackson p. 573; Kew 3: 448; Lasègue p. 545, 574; Moebius p. 122; MW p. 274, suppl. p.
203; NI 1197-1198; PR 5336-5339; SBC p. 125 ("Lindenb."); TL-1: 422, 689; TL-2/1:
1557, 2097; Urban-Berl. p. 306.
Anon., Bonplandia 2(22): 267. 1854 (cognomen in Leopoldina "Weber."); Bot. Zeit. 9:
	589. 1851; Flora 34: 574, 788. 1851; Österr. bot. W. 1: 315. 1851 (d. 6 Jun 1851).
Beck, G., Bot. Centralbl. 33: 314. 1888, 34: 149. 1888 (herb. at W, 9080 specim.).
Bullock, A. A., Bibl. S. Afr. bot. 70. 1978.

HEADING: LLINDER

	reviewed).
Rodgers, A. D., William Starling Sullivant 160, 164, 173. 1940.

see TL-2/2097.

4630. <em>Synopsis hepaticarum europaearum</em>, adnexis observationibus et adnotationibus criticis
illustrata, auctore I. B. G. Lindenberg, Dr., ditionis bergedorfensis praefecto. Cum tabulis

4631. <em>Monographie der Riccieen</em>, von Dr. J. B. W. Lindenberg, [Bonn (Acad. Leop.-Car. Nat.
Cur.) 1837]. Qu. (<em>Monogr. Ricc.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jan-Oct 1837 (submitted 28 Feb 1836; Flora "vorgelegt" 6 Nov 1837), <em>in</em> Nova Acta
	Acad. Leop. 18(1): 361-504, 504a-i, k-m, <em>pl. 19-37</em> (col. liths., anon.). <em>Copies</em>: B, FI, G, M,
	MO, NY. – We have seen no copy with independent pagination and/or renumbered
	plates.

4632. <em>Species hepathicarum</em>. Recensuit, partim descripsit iconibusque illustravit Ioh. Bernh.
Guil. Lindenberg [fasc. 6-11: et C. M. Gottsche] ... Bonnae (Impensis Henry et Cohen)
1839-1851, 11 fasc. Qu. (<em>Sp. hepat.</em>).

<em>Co-author</em> fasc. 6-11: Carl Moritz Gottsche (1808-1892).
1: 12-18 Apr 1839 (Hinrichs), p. [i]-iv, [5]-36, <em>pl. 1-6.</em>
<em>2-4</em>: 11-14 Mar 1840 (id.), p. 37-120, <em>pl. 7-24.</em>
<em>5</em>: 27 Dec 1843 (id.), p. i* (t.p. dated 1844), [i]-xxix (synopsis), [i]-vi (index), 121-164, <em>pl.
	25-33, 39</em>.
<em>6-7</em>: 21 Dec 1846 (id.), p. [i]-iv, [1]-78, <em>pl. 1-12.</em>
<em>8-11</em>: 10-11 Mar 1851 (id.), p. [i]-xii, [1]-118, [1, err.], <em>pl. 1-22.</em>
<em>Copies</em>: G, MICH, NY, USDA; IDC 5192. – The plates are (partly) coloured liths. – The
spelling <em>Hepathicarum</em> occurs on the t.p. of fasc. I. The titles on the fascicles of the subsequent
fascicles have <em>Hepaticarum</em>. The dates of availability at Bonn may have been somewhat
earlier than the dates of receipt by Hinrichs at Leipzig. The dates in Flora and Gersdorff
support the above dates.
The second series of pages with roman numerals, ([i]-xxix) was issued with fasc. 5 on 27 Dec
1843 according to the list of the contents of this fascicle in Gersdorff, Leipziger Repertorium
2(1): 121, 164, 516. 1844. This separate "chapter" contains a treatment of <em>Plagiochila</em> (p. i-
xiv) and a <em>Synopsis specierum</em> (p. xv-xxix). The title-page [i*] reads: <em>Monographia hepaticarum
generis Plagiochilae</em>... cum tabulis xxxiii. Bonnae (id.) 1844.
<em>Ref</em>.: Junk, W., Rara 1: 66. 1900-1913.

Linder, David Hunt (1899-1946), American mycologist; Ph. D. Harvard 1926; author on
fungi imperfecti; at the Shaw School of Botany, Washington, Univ., and the Missouri
botanical Garden, St. Louis 1926-1931; curator of the Farlow herbarium (1932-1946).
(<em>Linder</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: FH; duplicates see IH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 237, 331; Barnhart 2: 385; GR cat. p. 67; IH 1

HEADING: LINDER

(ed. 6): 361. 2: 446; Kew 3: 448; LS suppl. 16111-16118; MW p. 274, suppl. p. 204;

the authors.

Lindgren, Sven Johan (1810-1849), Swedish botanist; teacher at the Degeberg agricultu-
ral college in Västergötland. (<em>Lindgr</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: C. – Published (with Knut Frederik Thedenius, 1814-1894, and
Olof Leopold Sillén 1813-1894): (1). <em>Musci sveciae exsiccati</em>, fasc. 1-2, nos. 1-50, Upsala 1835;
(2). <em>Musci sveciae exsiccati</em>, fasc. 3-4, nos. 51-100, Gevaliae 1844;
(3). <em>Musci sveciae exsiccati</em>, fasc. 5-6, nos. 101-150, Gevaliae 1838 (ed. by K. F. Thedenius);
(4). Musci sveciae exsiccati, fasc. 7-8, nos. 151-200, Gevaliae 1838 (ed. by O. L. Sillén).
<em>Sets</em>: BM, C, FH, H, PC, QK, S.
<em>Ref</em>.: Sayre, G., Mem. New York Bot. Gard. 19(2): 226-227.
	1971; Bryologist 80: 512. 1978.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 385; CSP 4: 30; IH 2: 446; KR p. 412-413;
Rehder 5: 513; SBC p. 126 ("Lindgr."); Stevenson p. 1249; Zander ed. 10, p. 685, ed. 11, p.
781.
Anon., Flora 22:752. 1839.

Lindheimer, Ferdinand Jacob (1801-1879), German botanist; in 1834 as political
refugee to the United States; settled in 1840 at New-Braunfels, Texas, in which state he
collected extensively. (<em>Lindh</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: His collections from Texas (1842-1851), partly distributed as <em>Flora
texana exsiccata</em>, (fasc. 1-4, nos. 1-754, fasc. 5, ca 630 nos.) in many herbaria. An important
set is at GH, the basis for Engelmann and Gray's <em>Plantae lindheimerianae</em> (see no. 1690);
important scts at BAYLU, GH, MO, NA, SMU, YU.
Ref.: Gillett J. M. and M. J. Shchepanek, Taxon 26(4): 429-434. 1977 (isotypes at CAN;
	descr. of <em>Fl. tex. exsicc.</em>).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 330; Barnhart 2: 386; BM 3: 1119, 7:634; Bossert
p. 239 (b. 21 Mai 1801, d. 2 Dec 1879); Clokie p. 200; CSP 10: 603; DAB (by S. W. Geiser);
Hortus 3: 1198 ("Lindh."); IH 1 (ed. 6): 361, 2: 446; Jackson p. 365; Lasègue p. 467, 505
574; ME 2: 482, 491, 3: 445; Pennell p. 612; PR (alph.); Rehder 5: 513; TL-2/1: 1690, see
Durand, E. M.
Anon., Bot. Not. 1881: 39; Bot. Zeit. 38: 240. 2 Apr 1880; J. Bot. 18: 96. 1880; Nat. Nov. 2:
	31. 1880 (d.).
Blankinship, J. W., 18th. Ann. Rep. Missouri Bot. Gard. 123, 127-141. 1907 (portr.).

HEADING: LINDLEY

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Lindheimer settled at the town of New Braunfels, Texas, laid out in March 1845 by
Prince Carl Solms Braunfels, thirty miles north of San Antonio, on the initiative of the
German immigration company (Verein zum Schutze deutscher Auswanderer in Texas). A
picture of Lindheimers "Cabin on the Comal" at New Braunfels and much further
information is given e.g. by Elkinton (1945). Lindheimer was editor of the <em>New Braunsfelser
Zeitung</em> for nearly twenty years. See also Geiser (1948).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: <em>Aufsätze und Abhandlungen</em> von Ferdinand Lindheimer in Texas. Heraus-
gegeben von einem seiner Schüler. Frankfurt (Theodor Wentz) 1879, iv, 176 p. <em>Copy</em>: MO.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Lindheimera</em> A. Gray &amp; G. Engelmann (1847).

Lindinger, Karl Hermann Leonhard (1879-x), German botanist at Hamburg. (<em>Lin-
ding</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at B.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 386; BFM 1526, 3115; BL 1: 87, 306; BM 7: 634;
Hirsch p. 176; Hortus 3: 1198 ("Lindinger"); IH 2: 447; Kew 3: 448; Langman p. 446; LS
suppl. 16151; Moebius p. 146.
Anon., Nat. Nov. 35: 330. 1913 (asst. HBG).

	l'Archipel</em>. Paris 1909.
<em>Ref</em>.: Enger, A., Bot. Jahrb. 61 (Lit.): 2-3. 1927.

Lindley, John (1799-1865), British botanist; Dr. phil. München 1832; professor of botany
at University College London 1829-1860. (<em>Lindl</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: General herbarium (58.000 sheets) at CGE; types mainly in his own
herbarium, but some also at BM and K. The general herbarium (CGE) contains many
types of other botanists (J. G. Agardh: <em>Lupinus</em>, C. G. Nees <em>Cyperaceae</em>). <em>Orchid</em> herbarium
(incl. types and drawings) at K (reproduced on IDC microfiche 7395). Many letters at K;
others at G and HU. Letters to Miquel at U.

	London, now R. H. S.), 128 (general herb. to CGE at £ 300).
	Britten, J., J. Bot. 35: 463. 1897 (original plates at BM).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1). J. Donn, <em>Hortu cantabrigiensis</em>, ed. 10(1823), 11 (1826), 12 (1831), 13
(1845).
(2)Edited <em>Edwards's Botanical Register</em>, vol. 16-23, 1829-1847, but contributed most of the
articles from vol. 11 (1825) on (W. T. Stearn).
(3). <em>Illustrations of orchidaceous plants</em>, see F. A. Bauer.
(4). <em>Flora graeca</em>, see J. Sibthorp.
(5). <em>Gardeners Chronicle</em>, co-editor 1841-1865.
(6). <em>The ferns of Great Britain</em> (editor), see J. Moore.
(7). <em>Pomological Magazine</em>, editor vols. 1-3, 1828-1839.
(8). see Ravenscroft, E. J. for L's contribution to "<em>Lawson's Pinetum</em>" (parts 1-3).
(9). <em>Exotic flora</em>, see W.J. Hooker, no. 2993.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Lindleya</em> C. G. D. Nees (1821, <em>nom. rej.</em>); <em>Lindleya</em> Humboldt, Bonpland &amp; Kunth
(<em>1824, nom. cons.</em>); <em>Lindleyara</em> Garay &amp; Sweet (1966); <em>Lindleycladus</em> T. Harris (1979); <em>Lindleyel</em>-
<em>la</em> Rydberg (1908); <em>Lindleyella</em> Schlechter (1914); <em>Neolindleya</em> Kraenzlin (1899); <em>Neolindleyel</em>-
<em>la</em> Fedde (1940). – The library of The Royal Horticultural Society, in London, is named
<em>The Lindley library</em> (Catalogue: London, R.H.S., 1927, viii, 458 p.). For a history of the
Lindley library see Stageman, J. Roy. Hort. Soc. 93: 509-515. 1968.

and Youngman). 1819. Oct. (<em>Obs. struct, fruits.</em>).

arranged. With nineteen plates ... London (printed for James Ridgway,...) 1820. Oct. (in
fours). (<em>Ros. monogr.</em>).

4637. <em>Collectanea botanica</em>; or, figures and botanical illustrations of rare and curious exotic

PAGE: 52
HEADING: LINDLEY (1821)

plants ... London (printed by Richard and Arthur Taylor, ...) 1821. Fol. (<em>Coll. bot.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: In eight parts, 1821, p. [i, iii, v], <em>plates 1-41, A-B</em> with text, [1-4, appendix]. <em>Copies</em>: G,
	HH, NY; IDC 816.

part	plates	dates	part	plates	dates
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1	1-5	1 Apr 1821 (dated)	6	26-31	31 Oct 1821 (dated)
2	6-10	1 Apr 1921 (dated)			(+preface)
3	11-15	1 Mai 1821 (dated)	7	32-36	1821?
4	16-20	21 Oct 1821	8	37-41, A-B	Jan 1826
				app. Orch. scel.
5	21-25	1821

The evidence for the publication of fasc. 8 is still incomplete. The plates are mentioned in
Flora 7: 727 (14 Dec 1824), as to be published shortly, the watermark of <em>pl. 41</em> is of 1825; D.
Don's Prodr. Fl. Nepal. (1 Feb 1825) is cited on <em>pl. 14A.</em> Fasc. 8 also contains the Appendix
"Orchidearum sceletos" (see below). The date of this fascicle is most likely Jan 1826 (fide L.
E. Garay): Lindley cites it as "ined." on 1 Dec 1825 in Bot. Reg. 11. sub <em>pl. 395</em>, but as
published in Bot. Reg. 11: <em>pl. 953.</em> Feb 1826. In 1833 Lindley dated <em>Sarcanlhus</em> (<em>pl. 39B</em>) as of
1826 (Gen. Sp. Orch. pl. p. 233). Further research is still necessary; it is also not absolutely
certain that the plates were issued in numerical order as listed above. The 41 copper
engravings (40 coloured) are of drawings by Ferdinand Bauer, J. Curtis, M. Hart, William
Hooker, W. J. Hooker, Barbara Laurence and J. Lindley; 29 originals at BM.
<em>Ref</em>.: DU 181; GF p. 65; RS p. 113; SK 4: cxcvii.
	Kuntze, O., Rev. gen. 1: cxxxlii. 1891.
	Merrill, E. D., Contr. Gray Herb. 165: 30, 1947.

4638. <em>Digitalium monographia</em>; sistens historiam botanicam generis, tabulis omnium specie-
rum hactenus cognitarum illustratam, ut plurimum confectis ad icones Ferdinandi Bauer
penes Gulielmum Cattley, Arm.... Cura Johannis Lindley, ... Londini (typis Ricardi et
Arthuri Taylor: prostant venales apud J. H. Bohte, ...) 1821. Fol. (<em>Digital, monogr</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: Mai-Dec 1821 (p. ii: calend. Apr 1821, Flora 14 Jan 1822), front. <em>pl. l</em>, p. [i*,iii*], [i]-
	ii, [1]-27, [1, ind.], <em>pl. 1-28.</em> <em>Copies</em>: FI-BN, G, USDA. – Plates <em>1, 3, 8, 24, 27</em> are uncol., the
	others hand-col. copp. engr. by Ferdinand Bauer (22), Francis Bauer (1) and J. Lindley
	(5) – Several plates have watermarks which are later than the date of publ. Orig.
	drawings at RHS.
<em>Ref</em>.: Stearn, W. T., Roy. Hort. Soc. Exhib. mss. Books 41. 1954.

4639. <em>Report upon the new or rare plants</em> which have flowered in the garden of the Horticultural

4640. <em>Orchidearum sceletos</em>. Commisit Johannes Lindley. Londini (typos Ricardi Taylor)
1826. Oct. (<em>Orchid. scelet.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jan 1826 (see above under Collectanea botanica), p. [3]-27. <em>Copies</em>: G(2), NY, WU;
	IDC 5027. Text identical with Appendix of Collect. Bot. (see above); p. 23, 25, 27
	contain diagnostic details (p. 21, explicatio); – Lindley gave a copy to the British
	Museum on 19 Aug 1827. A verbatim reprint appeared in Linnaea 2: 527-532 (1827).

	1835. Duod.
<em>Ed.3</em>: Mai-Dec 1841 (p. viii: Apr 1841), p. [i]-viii, [1]-382. <em>Copies</em>: MICH, NY, MO. – "The
	third edition, with numerous additions, corrections, and improvements." London
	(Longman, Orme, Brown, Green, and Longmans, ...) 1841. Duod.

HEADING: LINDLEY (1830)

4642. <em>An outline of the first principles of botany</em>... London (published by Longman and Co.,
...) 1830. 18-mo
(<em>Outl. princ. bot.</em>). 

<em>Ed. 1</em>: 1 Mar 1830 (date on which Lindley signed the copy (MO) for Mrs. Lindley; copy
	Geol. Soc. pres. 6 Jun 1830), p. [i]-viii, [1, cont.], [1]-106, <em>pl. 1-4</em> (uncol. liths. auct.).
	<em>Copies</em>: G, MO.
<em>Ed. 2</em>: 1831, n.v., fide BM 2: 1129 "A second edition appeared in 1831." – The text was
	subsequently combined with the <em>Nixus plantarum</em> and issued as "<em>A key to structural</em>...
	<em>Botany</em>" (1835) and then as "<em>Elements of botany</em>..." from 1841 onward.

4643. <em>The genera and species of orchidaceous plants</em>... London (Ridgways, Piccadilly) April
1830 to October 1840. Oct. (in fours). (<em>Gen. sp. orchid, pl.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: in seven parts, as below. <em>Copies</em>: FI, G, MICH, MD, NY, USDA; IDC 5297. – The
	first four parts are entitled "The genera and species of orchideous plants." Each
	signature (of 8 pages) was dated at the bottom of the first page, and possibly distributed
	separately in advance of the part. Since contemporary reviews do not contradict this
	assumption, these dates of the signatures may be taken as the actual dates of publication.
	The signatures are dated as follows:

pages	dates	pages	dates	pages	dates
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1-40	Apr 1830	207-214	Apr 1833	381-388	Jan 1840
41-80	Mai 1830	215-256	Mai 1833	389-412	Feb 1840
81-94	Jun 1830	257-264	Aug 1835	413-428	Mar 1840
95-110	Jul 1831	265-296	Sep 1835	429-440	Apr 1840
111-133	Aug 1831	297-334	Oct 1835	441-528	Sep 1840
134-158	Dec 1832	335-350	Nov 1838	529-553	Oct 1840
159-190	Jan 1833	351-366	Dec 1838	[i]-xvii	Oct 1840
191-206	Mar 1833	367-380	Jan 1839

<em>1</em>: [i, t.p. part 1], [iii], [v], [1]-94, [1, ind.], rd by Linnean Soc. 29 Feb 1831, t.p. 1830.
<em>2</em>: [i, id. part 2], [iii, dated 22 Aug 1831], [95]-133, [1,ind.], rd by Linn. Soc. 10 Oct 1831;
	t.p. 1831.
<em>3</em>: [i*], [iii*], [i]-ix, index, [135]-255, id. 10 Jul 1833; t.p. 1833.
<em>4</em>: [i], [257]-334, t.p. 1835.
<em>5</em>: [i], 335-379, t.p. 1839.
<em>6</em>: [i], [381]-440, t.p. 1840.
<em>7</em>: [i], [441]-553. t.p. 1840.

<em>Facsimile ed</em>.: Amsterdam (A. Asher &amp; Co.) 1963, p. [i]-xvii, [1]-553 <em>Copies</em>: FAS, MICH,
	MO, NY, US. This edition lacks the t.p's etc. for the seven parts.
<em>Ref</em>.: RS p. 114; SK 4: cxcvii.
	Barnhart, J. H., unpublished notes at the NYBG.
	Sherborn, C. D., J. Soc. Bibl. nat. Hist. 1: 198. 1939.

4644. <em>An introduction to the natural system of botany</em>: or, a systematic view of the organisation,
natural affinities, and geographical distribution, of the whole vegetable kingdom; together
with the uses of the most important species in medicine, the arts, and rural or domestic
economy ... London (Longman, Rees, Orme, Brown, and Green ...) 1830. Oct. (<em>Inter. nat.syst. bot.</em>).

<em>Ed. 1</em>: Sep 1830 (see TL 1), p. [i]-xlviii, [1]-374, [1, err.]. <em>Copies</em>: FI, G, L, MICH, MO(2),
	NY, US, USDA. – Autograph draft at BM.
<em>First American ed</em>.: Dec 1831 (p.iv:Nov 1831; Amer. J. Sci. Jan 1832), p. [i]-lxxix, [1]-393,
	<em>2 pl. Copies</em>: MO, NY, USDA. – "First American edition, with an appendix by John
	Torrey, M.D...." New York (G. &amp; C. Carvill, ...) 1831. Oct. (in fours). <em>Editor</em> and
	author of appendix: John Torrey (1796-1873). Collaborators for the Appendix (a

PAGE: 54
HEADING: LINDLEY (1831)

	catalogue of North American genera of plants, replacing Corrca's <em>Reduct. gen. cat. pl.
	Amer.</em> 1815 (no. 1239)) were Abraham Halscy (1970-1857) and Lewis David von
	Schweinitz (1780-1834) for the fungi.
	"Great as the merits of the work undoubtedly are, we must nevertheless be excused from
	adopting the terms of extravagant and somewhat equivocal eulogy employed by a
	popular author, who gravely informs his readers that no book, since printed bibles were
	first sold in Paris by Dr. Faustus, ever excited so much surprise and wonder as did Dr.
	Torrey's edition of Lindley's Introduction of the Natural System of Botany. Now we can
	hardly believe that either the author or American editor, of the work referred to, were
	ever in danger, as was honest Dr. Faustus, of being burned for witchcraft; ..." (Asa Gray,
	1837, in rev. of ed. 2).
"<em>Ed. 2.</em> 1835" PR mentions a second edition of <em>An introduction to the natural system of botany</em>
	under his 5348. This does not exist; the pagination formula and the number of plates
	cited by him agree fully with the second edition of Lindley's "<em>An introduction to botany</em>..."
	1835 (see below). The actual second edition of the present work, of 1836, and entitled "A
	<em>natural system of botany</em>..." was treated by PR as a separate title under his no. 5357. The
	1835 ghost edition is also mentioned in Cat. libr. R.G.B. Kew 364 (1899); see also the
	note in TL 1/693.
<em>Ed. 2</em>: probably Jul 1836 (TL 1), p. [i]-xxvi, [1]-526. <em>Copies</em>: BR, FI, G, L, MO, NY, U, US,
	USDA. <em>Title</em>: "<em>A natural system of botany</em>; or, a systematic view of the organisation, natural
	affinities, and geographical distribution, of the whole vegetable kingdom; together with
	the uses of the most important species in medicine, the arts and rural or domestic
	economy ... Second edition, with numerous additions and corrections, and a complete
	list of genera, with their synonyms." London (Longman, Rees, Orme, Brown, Green,
	and Longman) 1836. Oct.
"<em>Ed. 3. 1839</em>" Pritzel (5348) also mentions a third edition of the present work, dated 1839,
	without providing pagination. This is almost certainly identical with ed. 3, 1839, of
	Lindley's "<em>An introduction to botany</em>."
<em>German transl</em>. by J. B. Wilbrand: 1833, p. [i]_viii, [1]-524. <em>Copies</em>: B, M, NY. – <em>Title</em>:
	"<em>Einleitung in das natürliche System der Botanik</em> oder systematische Uebersicht der Organisa-
	tion, natürlichen Verwandtschaften und geographischen Verbreitung des ganzen Pflan-
	zenreichs, nebst Angabe des Nutzens der wichtigsten Arten in der Heilkunde den
	Künsten und der Haus- und Feldwirthschaft ... Weimar" (im Verlage des Landes-
	Industrie-Comptoirs) 1833. Oct.
<em>German extract</em> by C. T. Beilschmied: 1833, p. [i-ii]. [1]-64. <em>Copy</em>: MO.– <em>Title</em>: John Lindley's
	... <em>Characteres distinctivi</em> oder Hauptkennzeichen der natürlichen Pflanzenfamilien. Aus
	Lindley's Introduction to the natural system of botany, Lond. 1830.; geordnet nach der
	von Kunth in seinem Handb. der Botanik, Berl. 1831, gewählten Folge, aus dem
	Englischen übersetzt von C. T. Beilschmied." Regensburg, 1833. Oct. Originally pub-
	lished in Lit. Ber. Flora 4: 33-48, 49-64, 65-80, 81-85. Mar-Mai 1834. A <em>Clavis analytica
	ordinum</em>, also translated by Beilschmied from the <em>Intr</em>. 1830 appeared in Flora 1832(2),
	Beibl. [1]-32.

4645. <em>The fossil flora of Great Britain</em>: or, figures and descriptions of the vegetable remains
found in a fossil state in this country ... London (James Ridgway, ...) 1831-1837, 3 vols.
Oct. (<em>Foss. fl. Gr. Brit.</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: William Hutton (1797-1860).
<em>Publ</em>.: In parts, the contents and precise dates are still unknown. The plates (uncol. liths.)
	are dated; these dates can be accepted as dates of publication. <em>Copies</em>: FI-BN, MO, NY,
	U, USGS.
	<em>1</em>: [i]-li, list subscr. [i]-x, [1]-218, [1-5, index], <em>pl. 1-19, 19bis, 20-79</em> (<em>1</em>: 1 Jul 1831; <em>79</em>: Apr
	18	33) (p.1-48, <em>1-14</em>. 1831; 49-166, <em>15</em>-<em>49</em>. 1832; 167-218, 50-79. 1833).
	<em>2</em>: [i]-xxviii, [1]-208, <em>pl. 80-156</em> (<em>80</em>: Jul 1833; 156: Apr 1835) (1-54, <em>80-99</em>. 1833; 57-156,
	<em>100-137</em>. 1834; <em>138-208</em>. 1835).
	<em>3</em>: [i], [1]-[205], [1-2, index], <em>pl. 157-230</em> (<em>157</em>: Jul 1835; <em>230</em>: Jul 1837) (1-72, <em>157-176</em>.
	1835; 73-122, <em>177-199</em>. 1836; 123-205, <em>195-230</em>. 1837).
<em>Reissue</em>: London "1831-1837" actually 1872 (see BM 3: 1121 and J. Bot. 10: 63. 1872 (ann.),
	287. Sep 1872 (vol. 1).
NI cites Arber who called the plates "exceedingly inaccurate" and mentions the issue of a
further 64 pl. by G. A. Lebour in 1877.

HEADING: LINDLEY (1838)

<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Lit. Ber. Flora 2: 97-112, 119-128, 137-144. Feb-Mai 1832 (fasc. 1-3),3:62-64.
	28 Apr 1833, 3: 65-67. 21 Mai 1833 (fasc. 4-5).
	Ward, Ann. Rep. U.S. Geol. Surv. 5: 408-410. 1885.

4650. <em>Victoria regia</em>. London 1837. Fol. (<em>Victoria regid</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 16 Oct 1837 (dedication to the queen), 7 p., <em>1 pl. Copy</em>: WU (inf. W. Gutermann);
	IDG 6027. – Privately printed by W. Nicol at the Shakspeare Press, Pall Mall, 25 copies
	(copy presented to Linnean Society on 7 Nov 1837). The lithographed plate is of a
	drawing by Schomburgk. Full title on the first page of the text itself: "A notice of Victoria
	regia, a new nymphaeaceaous plant discovered by Mr. R. H. Schomburgk in British
	Guayana."

4658. <em>Folia orchidacea</em>. An enumeration of the known species of orchids ... Vol. 1, London
(published for the author, by J. Matthews, ...) 1852-1855 [-1859] Oct. (<em>Fol. orchid.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Issued in nine parts, separately paged per genus. The "contents" list the genera
	treated with the date on which each was "printed". These latter dates are probably not
	the dates of distribution: as dates of publication it is best to accept the dates printed on the
	original wrappers of the parts (reproduced in the 1964 facsimile edition). These dates are
	given below; the dates of receipt at the British Museum are cited in brackets.

1	Stanhopea, Coryanthes, Ionopsis	[48 p.] Oct 1952 [6 Nov]
	Quekettia, Zygostates
	Odontoglossum, Didactyle
2	Sarcopodium, Sunipia	[48 p.] Jan 1853 [26 Jan]

	Erycina, Epidendrum p. 1-32
3	Epidendrum, p. 33-80	[48 p.] Feb 1853 [26 Feb]
4	Epidendrum p. 81-97, Hemiscleria, Pinelia,
	Acacallis, Abola, Oncodia, Cochlioda, Chei-
	radenia, Acampe, Vanda, Luisa	[52 p.] Apr 1853 [2 Mai]
5	Miltonia, Brassia, Ada, Polychilos, Corymbis,
	Sobralia, Coelogyne, Panisea	[46 p.] Feb 1854 [13 Feb]
6, 7	Calanthe, Oncidium, Lunatodis, Geodorum	Nov 1855 [6 Nov]
	Title-page and contents of vol. 1	[i]-iv, [80 p.]
	8	Stelis, Oberonia, Alvisia	[48 p.] Feb 1859 [14 Mar]
	Restrepia, Brachionidium, Pleurothallis p. 1-
	6; Prillieux, Observations.
9	Pleurothallis, concluded [40 p.] Mai 1859 [31
	Mai]

	by reprints of the covers. <em>Copies</em>: FAS, MO, NY, US.

4659. <em>Paxton's flower garden</em>. By Professor Lindley and Sir Joseph Paxton ... London [1850-]
1853, 3 vols. Qu. † (<em>Paxt. fl. gard.</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: Joseph Paxton (1803-1865).
<em>Publ</em>.: Ten volumes were planned. Publication was in monthly fascicles, 12 of which made a

PAGE: 58
HEADING: LINDLEY (1850)

	volume. Each fascicle contains 3 coloured plates with text and "Gleanings and original
	memoranda" (descriptions and drawings). A new edition, revised by T. Barrier was
	published in London, 1882-1884, 3 volumes. Qu. (see separate entry, below). The
	original edition has 108 hand-coloured lithographed plates by L. Constans and 314
	uncolourcd engraved text figures. The dates of publication given below were established
	bv Garay (1969). For the revised edition, 1882-1884, ed. Th. Baines, see under Paxton
	(1853).

	and Bombay (Longmans, Green, and Co. ...) Oct. <em>Collation</em>: identical with 1874 and
	1876 editions.

Lindman, Carl Axel Magnus (1856-1928), Swedish botanist and traveller; Dr. phil.
Uppsala 1886; teacher at Stockholm 1887-1904; from 1905 at the Natural History Museum
at Stockholm; travelled widely in Europe and North Africa; in Brazil 1892-1894. (<em>Lindm</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: S; duplicates in many herbaria.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 386 (d. 21 Jun 1928); BFM 1441, 1442; BJI 1:

Lindroth [later: Liro], Johan Ivar (1872-1943), Finnish botanist; 1921-1928 at Turku;
later director of the phytopathological institute at Helsinki. (<em>Lindr</em>.)

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: H, further material at HPP. – <em>Mycotheca fennica</em>, fasc. 1-18, nos. 1-
900, sets at B (extant), BM, C, E, FH, H, HPP, IMI, S, W. – Contributed fasc. 13-15, nos.
301-375, 1900 to Vestergren, T., <em>Micromycetes rariores</em>.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) Many data on Lindroth and his publications were placed at our disposal by P.
Isoviita and his colleagues at H.
(2) The names of new species in the <em>Mycotheca fennica</em>, fasc. 1-6, were not validly published
because they were published in 1935 with German descriptions (ICBN 36.1, see also 31.1).
The accompanying "Mycotheca fennica. Die Etiketten" of nos. 1-300 bears the dates of
printing (1-100) 20 Dec 1934, and (101-300) 28 Dec 1934 but the back cover of this separate
work carries the date 1935. The fascicles 1-3 themselves were presented to the Vanamo
Society on 22 Mar 1935. [P. Isoviita].

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Lindsaynium</em> Fée (1852, <em>orth. var.</em> of <em>Lindsaenium</em> Fée 1850), <em>Lindsayoides</em> Nakai
(1943), and <em>Protolindsaya</em> Copeland (1910) are related to <em>Lindsaea</em> [sic] Dryander ex Smith
(1793), which commemorates John Lindsay (x-1803), Jamaican botanist, correspondent of
Sir Joseph Banks. <em>Lindsayella</em> Ames &amp; C. Schweinfurth (1937) is dedicated to Walter R.
Lindsay (fl. 1935-1942), who collected in Panama.

Lingelsheim, Alexander von (1874-1937), German botanist; Dr. phil. Rostock 1906; at
the Botanical Museum and Garden, Breslau, 1904-1929; pharmacist 1929-1937; lecturer in
pharmacognosy 1926, professor 1932-1937.
(<em>Lingelsh</em>.).

Link, Johann Heinrich Friedrich (1767-1851), German nature philosopher and bota-
nist; Dr. med. Göttingen 1789; at Rostock 1792; director botanical garden Breslau 1811-
1815; professor of botany at Berlin 1815-1851; successor to Willdenow. (<em>Link</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Link's personal herbarium was acquired by Berlin-Dahlem (B) after
his death (now for the greater part destroyed, but e.g. Pteridophyta preserved). Link was
the actual founder of this herbarium. Practically all Link's types are (or were) at B. Link's
library was sold by auction. – Link material is found at BR, C, FI, H, LIV, P, PH, W.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 18: 715-720; AG 2(1): 366, 2(2): 150-151; Ainsworth
p. 61, 70, 102, 300, 313; Backer p. 331; Barnhart 2: 388; BM 3: 1124-1125, 7: 635; Bossert p.
239 (b. 2 Feb 1767, d. 1 Jan 1851); Bret. p. 275; Colmeiro 1: clxxxv; CSP 4: 35-38, 12: 449;
Dawson p. 543, 943; De Toni 1: lxxviii, 2: lxxvi; Dryander 5: 328; DSB 8: 373-374 (bibl., sec.
refs.); DTS 1: 173; DU 185; Frank 3 (Anh.): 58; GR p. 29, <em>pl</em>. [<em>15</em>], cat. p. 67; Hegi 6(2): 911;
Herder p. 463; Hortus 3: 1198 ("Link"); IF p. 714, suppl. 4: 329; IH 1 (ed. 6): 25, 361, 2:

4694. <em>Icones plantarum selectarum</em> horti regii botanici berolinensis cum descriptionibus et
colendi ratione auctoribus H. F. Link directore et F. Otto inspectore horti ... Berolini
[Berlin, author; on covers: Gedruckt in der Deckerschen Geh. Ober-Hofbuchdruckerei]
1820-1828, 10 parts. Qu. (<em>Icon. pl select.</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: Christoph Friedrich Otto (1783-1856).
<em>Publ</em>.: In ten parts. Alternative title: "<em>Abbildungen auserlesener Gewächse</em> des königlichen
	botanischen Gartens zu Berlin nebst Beschreibungen und Anleitung sie zu ziehen." This
	German title was also used on the original covers. General t.p.'s (German and Latin)
	were issued with part 10; they are dated "Berlin, 1828." Such a set of t.p.'s was also issued
	for part 1, ("Fasciculus primus," "Erstes Heft") dated Berlin 1820, but not for the other
	Hefte. This double set of t.p.'s was not always kept in binding; furthermore they may
	have been bound facing each other (ii-iii) or following each other [i,iii]. The ideal
	pagination formula is [ii-iii, gen. t.p.'s], [v, ind.], [2-3, t.p.'spart 1], [5]-128, <em>pl. 1-60.</em> For
	plates see note below. The copy at G has all original covers and shows the year dates of
	publication. The dates below are based on the data used for TL-1 with additional
	references from the contemporary literature.

HEADING: LINK (1820)

4699. <em>Icones plantarum rariorum</em> horti regii botanici berolinensis cum descriptionibus et

<em>Publ</em>.: In eight parts. Alternative title (actually on main t.p. [iii]): "<em>Abbildungen neuer und
	seltener Gewächse</em> des königlichen botanischen Gartens zu Berlin nebst Beschreibungen

4700. <em>Handbuch</em> zur Erkennung der nutzbarsten und am häufigsten vorkommenden Ge-
wächse ... Berlin (In der Haude und Spenerschen Buchhandlung (S. J. Joseephy.)) 1829-
1833, 3 vols. Oct. (<em>Handbuch</em>).

1. <em>Erster Theil</em>: Jan-Aug 1829, p. [ii]-viii, [1]-864.<em>
2. Zweiter Theil</em>: Jan-Aug 1829, p. [ii-iii], [1]-533.<em>
3. Dritter Theil</em>: 1833, p. [ii]-xviii, [1]-536.
<em>Copies</em>: B, BR, FI, M, NY, Regensburg (vols. 1-2), US; IDC 5244.
<em>Alternative title</em>: The book was also issued as part of the sixth edition of C. L. Willdenow,
	<em>Grundriss der Kräuterkunde</em>, zweiter-vierter (praktischer) Theil. The first "Theil" of the
	Grundriss ed. 6, "Erster (theoretischer) Theil" was still attributed to Willdenow and
	simply edited by Link. The "practical" part, however, was transformed by him into the
	<em>Handbuch</em>. Most copies have the alternative t.p.'s [ii]; the US copy was issued without
	them and belongs therefore to the independent issue of the Handbuch.
<em>Ref</em>.: Brizicky, G., Taxon 18: 651. 1969.

4701. Ueber eine neue Cactus-Art, <em>Echinocactus oxygonus</em> Link nebst Beschreibung, Cultur-
Methode und einigen andern Bemerkungen. Berlin 1830. Qu. (<em>Echinocactus oxygonus</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: Christoph Friedrich Otto (1783-1856).
<em>Publ</em>.: 1830, p. [1]-19, <em>pl. 1</em>, handcol. liths. <em>Copy</em>: G. – Reprinted from Verh. Ver. Beförd.
	Gartenb. Lieferung 13.

Linkola, Kaarlo (until 1906 Collan) (1888-1942), Finnish botanist; Dr. phil. Helsinki
1919; assistant at the Botanical Institute of the agricultural section of Helsinki Univ. 1913-
1922, from 1917 also working at the Tammisto experiment station; professor of botany at
Turku Univ. 1923-1925, id. at Helsinki 1925-1942. (<em>Linkola</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: H; other material at BP, C, GB, L.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 388; BFM no. 2153, 2418, 2419; BJI 2: 106-107;
BL 2: 58, 73-74, 80, 85, 93, 95, 96, 477, 683; BM 7: 635; Collander p. 315-325 (q.v. for bibl.
and for many biogr. refs.), hist. p. 156; GR p. 620, <em>pl</em>. [<em>41</em>]; Hawksworth p. 284; IH 2: 448;
TL-2/2826.
Anon., Österr. bot. Z. 76(1): 88. 1927 (app. Helsinki).
Gager, C. S., Brooklyn Bot. Gard. Rec. 27: 193. 1938.
Gröntved, Johs., Bot. Tidsskr. 46: 88-90. 1942 (b. 6 Jun 1888, d. 26 Apr 1942, obit., portr.).
Pesola, V. A., Kaarlo Linkola kirjeenvaihtokumppanin näkemänä, Werner Söderström
	osakeyhtrö, Porvoo, Helsinki 1966, 108 p. (biogr., portr.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: Edited part 6 of Hjelt, <em>Consp.fl. fennic.</em>,
see TL-2/2826.

<em>2</em>: 1921, p. [1]-491, 4 charts, Ib. 45(2). Copy: FI.

PAGE: 71
HEADING: LINNAEUS

<em>Publ</em>.: 1920, p. [1]-24, 1 tab. <em>Copy</em>: FI. – Ann. Soc. zool.-bot. fenn. Vanamo 1(1), 1920.

Linnaeus, Carl (from 1761: Carl von Linné) (1707-1778), Swedish botanist, physician
and zoologist; Dr. med. Harderwijk 1735; in the Netherlands 1735-1738, for the greater
part of the time as physician to George Clifford at the Hartecamp near Haarlem; from
1738-1741 practicing physician at Stockholm; professor of medicine and botany at Uppsala
1741-1778; founder of modern plant systematics and nomenclature. (<em>L</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: For a general and detailed review of the Linnaean herbaria and of
the other herbaria used by Linnaeus see W. T. Stearn's introduction to vol. 1 of the Ray
Society facsimile of the <em>Species plantarum</em>. The main type herbarium is the Linnaean
herbarium at the Linnean Society of London (LINN), available on IDC microfiches
(Indexes: Jackson 1912, Savage 1945). It should be emphasized that for several reasons,
amply explained by Stearn, the specimens now in the Linnaean herbarium may have no
relation to the entry under the same name in the <em>Species plantarum</em>.
The Linnaean herbarium at Stockholm (S), also available on IDC microfiches (no. 5075),
consists mainly of plants given by Linnaeus to his son or to colleagues, or of plants grown in
the Uppsala botanic garden during Linnaeus's life-time. The main sources of this herba-
rium were the herbaria of Linnaeus fil., Alströmer, Montin and Solander. Although the
specimens of this herbarium can rarely be considered types, they still have great importance
for the interpretation of the Linnaean taxa. Small collections of Linnaean plants are also at
H, SBT and UPS. Linnaeus's Lapland herbarium, given by him to Johannes Burman, is
now at the Institut de France, Paris. The main herbaria of other botanists used by Linnaeus
are those of Burser at Uppsala (UPS) (available on IDC microfiches), Hermann (BM),
Sloane (BM), Dillenius (OXF), for details of which see Stearn.
A very important Linnaean type herbarium is the Clifford herbarium at BM, which
contains many of the types of the <em>Hortus cliffortianus</em>. For the Linnaean specimens at UPS see
Juel (1931).
<em>Ref</em>.: (main items only, a fuller list is given by Stearn 1957, pp, 123-124).
	Alston, A. H. G., Proc. Linn. Soc. London 168: 102-103. 1957 (Lapland herb.).
	Blake, S. F., Rhodora 20: 21-28, 48-54, 65-73. 1919 (Notes on the Clayton herbarium).
	Dandy, J. E., The Sloane herbarium. London 1957.
	Fries, R. E., Sv. Linné-Sällsk. Årsskr. 18: 109-123, 160. 1935 (Linné-växter in Bergii
	herbarium).
	Fuchs, H. P., Taxon 4: 62-67. 1955 (interpretation types in herb. LINN).
	Jackson, B. D., Index to the Linnaean herbarium with indication of the types of species
	marked by Carl von Linne. Proc. Linn. Soc. London sess. 124 Suppl. 1912, 38 p.;
	Linnaeus. London 1923, pp. 343-358.

<sm>EPONOMY</sm> (genera): <em>Hammarbya</em> O. Kuntze (1891, "sie sei dem berühmtesten Naturforscher
aller Zeiten, dem Herrn von Hammarby gewidmet, ..." Linnaeus, in 1758, bought the
small country estate of Hammarby near Uppsala, which "became his beloved retreat in the
summer months and is today a place of pilgrimage for all who revere him." Blunt (1971, p.
167), <em>Linnaea</em> Linnaeus (1753); <em>Linnaeopsis</em> Engler (1900); (journal): <em>Linnaea</em>. Ein Journal für
die Botanik in ihrem ganzen Umfang. Berlin &amp; Halle. Vol. 1-43. 1826-1882.

(1963) yv. 510 (house at Hammarby), 1,30 kr. (1978), yv.

	<em>ed. 11</em>: "Leipzig 1762 Oct.", mentioned by Linnaeus himself in the ratio editions of ed. 12.
	STR, Hulth and Soulsby suspect that this edition is non-existent. KR, p. 425 and
	Tournay call the Halle 1760 reprint of ed. 10 the eleventh edition.

	see SO 143-182b.
	<em>Systema vegetabilium</em>: The botanical part of later editions of the <em>Systema naturae</em> was issued
	several times as <em>Systema vegetabilium</em> (counting from ed. 12):
	<em>ed. 13</em>: 1774 (see also under J. A. Murray), SO 573, see TL-2/4844 a and STR 6838. N.B.
	The botanical novelties in this edition still stem from Linnaeus and must be attributed
	to him. Murray acted here as editor.
	<em>ed. 14</em>: 1784, see under J. A. Murray, SO 583, TL-2/6575, STR 6839. Revised by Murray.
	Novelties to be attributed to him.
	<em>ed. 1</em>5: 1789, see under J. Scannagatta, SO 598.
	<em>ed. 1</em>5: 1797, see under C. H. Persoon, SO 603, STR 7336.
	<em>ed. 15</em>: 1798, see under J. A. Murray, SO 608, TL-2/6578, STR 6840.
	<em>ed. 16</em>: 1817-1830, see under J. J. Roemer et J. A. Schultes SO 613, STR 7697.
	<em>ed. 16</em> [ed. 17]: 1825-1828, see under K. Sprengel, SO 616, STR 8499.
	<em>ed. 18</em>: 1835, see under H. E. Richter (Caroli Linnaei Opera), SO 25-26, STR 5917. – A
	further edition, Coimbra 1838, is mentioned by Tournay.
	<em>General references</em>: SO 39-182b, KR p. 424-430 (no. 1) and Tournay (Bull. Soc. bot. Belg.
	86: 125-127. 1953) provide reviews of all editions as well as secondary references. – See
	also Heller, J. L., Classical mythology in the Systema Naturae ..., Trans. Amer.
	philol. Ass. 76: 333-357. 1945.

4710. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Fundamenta botanica</em> quae majorum operum prodromi instar
theoriam scientiae botanices per breves aphorismos tradunt ... Amstelodami [Amsterdam]
(apud Salomonem Schouten) 1736. Oct.
(<em>Fund. bot.</em>) (SO 253, KR 135, STR 5350). 

<em>Orig. ed</em>: 13 Sep 1735 (t.p. 1736), p. [i-iv], [1]-35, [36]. <em>Copies</em>: G(2), MO, U; IDC 164. –
	Issued both as a separate work and as part of the <em>Bibliotheca botanica</em>. The aphorisms 210-
	314 are the basis of the <em>Critica botanica</em>; the entire text became later the basis for the
	<em>Philosophia botanica</em> (1751). – Errata appear on the errata sheet of the <em>Bibliotheca</em>.
<em>Facsimile ed</em>. [1]: 1961, p. [i-iv], [1]-35, [36], colophon loose leaflet. <em>Copies</em>; FAS, U. – 100

PAGE: 78
HEADING: LINNAEUS (1736)

	copies issued with colophon leaflet by J. Cramer (Weinheim, later Lehre) "greeting the
	year of 1961."

	München (Werner Fritsch). <em>Copy</em>: FAS.

4713. Caroli Linnaei, sveci, <em>Methodus</em> juxta quam physiologus accurate &amp; feliciter concin-
nare potest historiam cujuscumque naturalis subjecti, sequentibus hisce paragraphis com-
prehensa, ... Lugduni batavorum [Leiden] (apud Angelum Sylvium) 1736. Broadsheet
(<em>Methodus</em>), (SO 40, STR 5550). 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1736, issued as an appendix to <em>Syst. nat.</em> 1735 (reprinted in eds. 2-9, 1740-1756 as
	Methodus demonstrandi animali, vegetabilia aut lapides."). Usually bound as a fly leaf
	with copies of the <em>Syst. nat.</em> <em>Copy</em>: HU.
<em>Facsimile reprint</em>: 1960, I p. <em>Copy</em>: <em>U</em>. – Bokgillet, Uppsala/Sweden.
<em>Translation and notes</em>: See K. P. Schmidt, J. Soc. Bibl. nat. Hist. 2(9): 369-374. 1952 (STR
	8006).

4714. Caroli Linnaei ... Genera plantarum eorumque characteres naturales secundum
numerum, figuram, situm, &amp; proportionem omnium fructificationis partium ... Lugduni
batavorum (Apud Conradum Wishof1) 1737. Oct. (in fours).
(<em>Gen. pl.</em>). (SO 284, KR 2,
STR 5376). 

<em>Publ</em>.: early 1737, p. [i-xvi], clavis classium (chart), 1-168, 167[bis]-168[bis], 169-366, 372
	[text continuous]-380 (as "384"), [1-20, index]. <em>Copies</em>: G, MO, US(2), USDA; IDC
	556. – Somewhat later copies were issued together with:
	(1) a plate by G. D. Ehret "Caroli Linnaeus classes sive litterae" bound either with the
	<em>Genera</em> or the <em>Methodus</em>. The orginal of this plate is at BM. – See Bryk, 1954, p. 176, and
	Uggla, A. H., Sv. Linné-Sälsk. Årsskr. 22: 108-113. 1939.
	(2) the <em>Corollarium</em>, see below TL-2/4716.
	(3) the <em>Methodus</em>, see below TL-2/4715.
<em>Secondary publications</em>: see e.g. SO 286-296, KR 2, the introduction by W. T. Stearn to the
	facsimile ed. of ed. 5 (Weinheim 1960), Bryk (Taxon 3: 176-177. 1954), Tournay (Bull.
	Soc. bot. Belg. 86: 127. 1953), Franchet, J. de Bot 1: 171-173. 1887; and Stafleu, Linnaeus
	and the Linnaeans (1971) p. 373 [index].
<em>Further editions</em>: <em>ed</em>.2, Leiden 1742, SO 297, see TL-2/4723, STR 5377.
	<em>ed</em>. 3: Paris 1743, SO 299, see TL-2/4725, STR 5378.
	<em>ed</em>. 4: Halle 1752, by C. C. Strumpff, SO 300, see TL-2/4767, STR 5379.
	<em>ed</em>. 5: Stockholm 1754, SO 301, see TL-2/4778, STR 5380.
	<em>ed</em>. 6: Stockholm 1764, SO 305, see TL-2/4823, STR 5382.
	<em>editio novissima</em>: Wien 1767, SO 315, see TL-2/4833, STR 5383.
	<em>ed</em>. 7: Frankfurt a. Main 1778, SO 320, see J. J. Reichard, STR 7502.
	<em>ed</em>. 8(a): Frankfurt a. Main 1789-1791, SO 322, see under J. C. D. Schreber, STR 8034.
	<em>ed</em>. 8(b): Wien 1791, SO 324, Th. Haenke, TL-2/2238, STR 2852.
	<em>ed</em>. 9: Göttingen 1830-1831, SO 327, see K. P. J. Sprengel, STR 8497.

4715. Caroli Linnaei medici <em>Methodus</em> <em>sexual</em> is sistens genera plantarum secundum mares et

PAGE: 80
HEADING: LINNAEUS (1737)

feminas in classes et ordines redacta. Lugduni batavorum [Leiden] (Apud Coenradum
Wishoff) 1737. Oct. (in fours).
(<em>Meth. sex.</em>), (SO 285, KR 2, STR 5551). 

<em>Publ</em>.: Sep-Dec 1738 (then issued in combination with the earlier published <em>Gen. pl.</em> ed. 1), p.
	[1]-23 sometimes with pl. and/or chart of <em>Gen. pl.</em>). <em>Copies</em>: G, U, US, USDA (with pl.
	and chart). For secondary literature see under <em>Gen. pl.</em> ed. 1, 1737.

4716. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Corollarium</em> generum plantarum, exhibens genera plantarum
sexaginta, addenda prioribus characteribus, expositis in Generibus plantarum. Accedit
Method us sexualis. Lugduni batavorum (Apud Conradum Wishoff) 1737. Oct. (in fours).
(<em>Corollarium</em>), (SO 285, KR 2, STR 4813). 

<em>Publ</em>.: Sep-Dec 1737 (then issued with the earlier publ. <em>Gen. pl.</em> ed. 1), p. [i-vi], 1-25. <em>Copies</em>:
	G, MO, US, USDA. – For secondary publications see <em>Gen. pl.</em> ed. 1, 1737.

4717. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Flora Lapponica</em> exhibens plantas per Lapponiam crescentes,
secundum systema sexuale collectas in itinere impensis Soc. reg. litter. et scient. Sueciae a.
[mdccxxxii]. Instituto Additis synonymis, &amp; locis natalibus omnium, descriptionibus &amp;
figuris rariorum, viribus medicatis &amp; oeconomicis plurimarum. Amstelaedami [Amster-
dam] apud Salomonem Schouten) 1737. Oct. (<em>Fl. lapp.</em>), (SO 279, KR 16, STR 5336). 

<em>Publ</em>.: Apr 1737, frontisp., p. [i-xxxix], [1]-372, [1-12, index], [1-26: emend., poem by Joh.
	Browallius, expl. pl.], <em>pl</em>. 1-12 (uncol. copp.). <em>Copies</em>: G, HU, MO(2), U, US, USDA; IDC
	163. – The <em>Flora lapponica herbarium</em> is at the Institut de France, Paris (in library B.
	Delessert). For secondary publications see e.g. SO 279a-280a, 282, Stafleu (1971, p. 372,
	index), and HU 502 (q.v. for precise collation).
<em>Editio altera</em>: 1792 (p. [iii]: Feb 1792), frontisp., p. [i*-iii*], i-l, [1]-390, [1-16] <em>pl. 1-12</em> with
	text (uncol. copp.). <em>Copies</em>: G, MO, Stevenson, US, USDA. – Edited by J. E. Smith. See
	also BL 2: 516-517 and STR 5337.
<em>Swedish translation</em>: 1905, in T. M. Fries, Skrifter af Carl von Linné, vol. 1 (SO 283, STR
	5338). 391 p.
<em>Travelogues</em>: For Linnaeus's manuscript journal of the <em>Iter lapponicum</em> see J. E. Smith, <em>Lachesis
	lapponica</em>, 2 vols., London 1811 (SO 192) and SO 196-197a, STR 5442. – See also C. O. v.
	Sydow, Sv. Linné-Sällsk. Årsskr. 1972-74: 22-74. 1978.

4718. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Critica</em> <em>botanica</em> in qua nomina plantarum generica, specifica, &amp;
variantia examini subjiciuntur, selectiora confirmantur, indigna rejiciuntur; simulque
doctrina circa denominationem plantarum traditur. Seu Fundamentorum botanicorum
pars iv. Accedit Johannis Browallii de necessitate historiae naturalis discursus. Lugduni
Batavorum [Leiden] (apud Conradum Wishoff) 1737. Oct. (<em>Crit. bot.</em>), (SO 276, KR 136,
STR 4815). 

<em>Author of Discursus</em>: Johan Browallius, bishop of Åbo (1707-1755).
<em>Publ</em>.: early Jul 1737 (p. iv: 22 Jun 1737; Neue Zeit. gel. Sach. 1739: 455-458), p. [i-xvi], 1-
	270, [1-36, index, err.]. <em>Copies</em>: G, MO(2), US, USDA. – An elaboration of the aphorisms
	210-314 of the <em>Fundamenta botanica</em>; it contains for instance an outline of L's ideas on
	generic nomenclature. See also Stafleu (1971, p. 370, index), and especially the English
	translation by Arthur Hort (see below).
	<em>Discursus</em>: issued with the <em>Critica</em> with independent t.p. and pagination: [i-viii], 1-24, [1-8,
	index]. <em>Copies</em>: as above. "<em>Discursus de introducenda</em> in scholas et gymnasia praecipue vero in
	gymnasium arosiense <em>historiae naturalis lectione</em>, ad ... auct. Johanne Browallis. Lugduni
	batavorum [Leiden] (apud Conradum Wishoff) 1737. Oct.
<em>English translation</em>: 1938, p. [i]-xxvii, [1]-239. <em>Copies</em>: FAS, MO, Stevenson, U, US. – "The
	"Critica botanica" of Linnaeus translated by the late Sir Arthur Hort, ... revised by
	Miss M. L. Green, ... with an introduction by Sir Arthur Hill, ... London (printed for
	the Ray Society ...) 1938. Oct. – STR 4816.
<em>Reprint</em>: in J. E. Gilibert, Syst. pl. Eur. 7: 363-594. 1787. See SO 20, 21, 277, TL-2/2014,
	STR 4795.
<em>Commentary</em>: See A. J. Retzius, Obs. crit. bot. Linné, 1811 (SO 278, STR 7540).

4719. <em>Hortus cliffortianus</em> plantas exhibens quas in hortis tam vivis quam siccis, Hartecampi
in Hollandia, coluit vir nobilissimus &amp; generosissimus Georgius Clifford juris utriusque
doctor, reductis varietatibus ad species, speciebus ad genera, generibus ad classes, adjectis
locis plantarum natalibus differentiisque specierum. Cum tabulis aeneis. Auctore Carolo

PAGE: 81
HEADING: LINNAEUS (1740)

Linnaeo, ... Amstelaedami [Amsterdam]. 1737. Fol. (<em>Hort. cliff.</em>), (SO 328, KR 121, STR
5405). 

<em>Collections owned by</em>: George Clifford (1685-1760), see TL-2/1: 511-512.
<em>Publ</em>.: 1738 (distributed to friends; on the market only in 1739), p. [i**, iv**], frontisp.,
	[v**, t.p.], [i*-xxii*], [i]-x, i-iv, 1-231, [232, blank], 301-501, [502, err.], [1-16,
	indexes], <em>pl. 1-36</em> (uncol. copp. J. Wandelaar and G. D. Ehret). <em>Copies</em>: HU, MO(2),
	U(2), US; IDC 167. – See Stearn (1957) for a discussion of the way the book was made
	available to the botanical public. Copies were handed out sparingly to friends of Clifford,
	but the book did not come on the market before 1739. See Heller (1968) for an extensive
	study, and HU 504 for an analytical collation. The 36 uncoloured (copies at Bibl. natl.,
	Paris, and Uppala Univ. have coloured plates) copper- engravings (some unsigned) are
	of drawings by G. D. Ehret and J. Wandelaar. The pagination shows a break: 1-231, 301-
	501. "The text was partly printed in quarto, but, owing to the size of the plates had to be
	reprinted in <em>folio</em>, which accounts for the pagination" (SO). – An abridgement was
	published with the title <em>Viridiarum cliffortianum</em>. Amsterdam 1737 (PR 5409, SO 331)
	which (Richter) was published Jun-Oct 1737. – George Clifford's herbarium containing
	many of the plants described by Linnaeus is at BM.
<em>Facsimile ed</em>.: 1968, p. [i***-iv***], [i**-ii*], frontisp., [iii*, t.p.], [i*-xxii*] [i]-x, i-iv, 1-
	231, [232, blank], 301-501, [502, err.], [1-16, indexes], <em>pl. 1-36</em> (on 18 leaves). <em>Copies</em>:
	FAS(2), MO. – ISBN 3-7682-0543-6, Historiae naturalis classica 63, Lehre (J. Cramer).
	– STR 5406.
<em>Ref</em>.: Callmer, C. and O. Gertz, Sv. Linné-Sällsk. Arsskr. 26: 81-88. 1953 (on illustrations).
	Heller, J. L., Huntia 1: 56-60. 1964; Taxon 17: 663-719. 1968 (extensive study), 19: 357-
	411. 1970.
	Rendle, A. E., J. Bot. 61: 114-116. 1923 (on Clifford here).
	Springer, L. F., Sv. Linné-Sällsk. Årsskr. 19: 59-66. 1936 (on the Hartecamp).
	Stearn, W. T., An introduction ... Species plantarum p. 49, 172 [index]. 1957.

4720. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Classes plantarum</em>. Seu systemata plantarum omnia a fructificatione
desumta, quorum xvi universalia &amp; xiii partialia; compendiose proposita secundum classes,
ordines et nomina generica cum clave cujusvis methodi et synonymis genericis. Fundamen-
torum botanicorum pars ii. Lugduni batavorum [Leiden] (Apud Conradum Wishoff)
1738. Oct. (<em>Class. pl.</em>), (SO 332, KR 137, STR 4803). 

<em>Orig. ed</em>.: 1738 (p. [vii]: 20 Mar 1738), p. [i-viii], pages with column nos. (2/p.): [1]-606, p.
	607-656, [657; on verso of 656]. <em>Copies</em>: G, MO, U, US, USDA; IDC 160. – See aphorisms
	53-77 of <em>Fundamenta botanica</em> 1736 in which "this work is foreshadowed" (SO). For a
	discussion see Stafleu (1971), p. 369 [index]; see also SO 333-338.
<em>Reprint</em>[1]: 1747, p. [i-viii], col. [1]-606, p. 607-656, [657]. <em>Copies</em>: MO, USDA. – SO 333,
	STR 4804.
<em>Reprint</em>[2]: 1907, in T. M. Fries, ed., Skrifter af Carl von Linné, 3, 1907. (SO 335, see also
	334; STR 4807).
<em>French transl</em>.: see Mouton de Fontenille 1798, 1804 (TL-2/6381, 6384, and STR 6794,
	6795).
<em>Ref</em>.: Stafleu, F. A., Linnaeus and the Linnaeans 369 [index]. 1971.

4721. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Systema naturae</em> in quo natura regna tria, secundum classes,
ordines, genera, species, systematice proponuntur ... Editio secunda, auctior. Stockhol-
miae (apud Gottfr. Kiesewetter) 1740. Oct.(<em>Syst. nat. ed.</em> 2), (SO 46, KR 1, STR 5926). 

<em>Publ</em>.: Mai 1740, p. [i-iv], [1]-80. <em>Copy</em>: MO (issue 1). – See SO 46 for further details.
	Contains also the text of Fund. bot. ed. 2.–See also SO 143-182b, Sandberg 3, and STR
	5926 (issues 1,2,3).
<em>Reprint</em>: in <em>Opera varia</em>, 1758 (see below and STR 5600), with slight changes.

4722. Caroli Linnaei, ... <em>Systema naturae</em>, sive regna tria naturae systematice proposita per
classes, ordines, genera et species. Caroli Linnaei, ... Natur-Systema, oder die in ordentli-
chem Zusammenhange vorgetragene drey Reiche der Natur, nach ihren Classen, Ordnun-
gen, Geschlechtern und Arten, in die deutsche Sprache übersetzet, mit einer Vorrede
herausgegeben von Johann Joachim Langen, ... Halle (gedruckt mit Gebauerischen
Schriften) 1740. Fol (<em>Syst. nat. ed. 3</em>), (SO 47, STR 5927). 

<em>Editor</em>: Johann Joachim Lange (<em>fl</em>. 1740).

HEADING: LINNAEUS (1740)

<em>Publ</em>.: 1740 (p. [viii]: 4 Mai 1740), p. [i-viii], [1]-70, [1, err.]. <em>Copy</em>: HH. – A reprint of ed. 1
	(1735), slightly re-arranged, with a German translation in parallel columns.

4723. Caroli Linnaci ... <em>Genera plantarum</em> eorumque characteres naturales secundum

4724. Q. F. F. Q. S. Dissertatio botanica de <em>Betula nana</em>, quam, consensu amplissime Fac.

<em>Publ</em>.: 30 Jun 1743, p. [i-iv], 1-20, <em>1 pl</em>. (uncol. copp.). <em>Copies</em>: MO(2), USDA. – Further

4725. <em>Genera plantarum</em> eorumque characteres naturales, secundum numerum figuram,
situm, &amp; proportionem omnium fructificationis partium. Authore Carolo Linnaeo, ...
Editio secunda, nominibus plantarum gallicis locupletata ... Parisiis (sumptibus Michaelis
Antonii David, ...) 1743. Oct. (<em>Gen. pl. ed. 3</em>), (SO 299, KR 2, STR 5378). 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1743, p. [i]-xxxii, clavis, <em>pl. 1-2</em> [1-2, expl. pl.], 1-413, [414-439, index], [440-470
	meth. calyc. etc.], [1-2, privil.]. <em>Copies</em>: G(2), MO, US(2), USDA. – Contains the text of
	ed. 2, 1742, with French vernacular plant names and some fragments from the <em>Class. pl.</em>;
	it counts as ed. 3 notwithstanding the "editio secunda" on the title page. Linnaeus was
	not involved in the publication.–See SA 2: 574, Bryk (1954) and Stearn (1960). Edited
	by a "Mr Monnier" at Paris, see Bryk.
<em>Ref</em>.: Bryk, F., Taxon 3: 177-178, 1954.
	Stearn, W. T., Notes on Linnaeus's Genera plantarum, <em>in</em> facs. ed. of ed. 5, Weinheim
	1960.

4726. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Oralio de necessitate peregrinationum</em> intra patriam. Ejusque elenchus
animalium per sueciam observatorum. Accedunt Johannes Browalii Examen epicriseos
Siegesbeckianae in systema plantarum sexuale et Johannis Gesneri ... dissertationes de
partium vegetationis et fructificationis structura, differentia et usu, in quibus elementa
botanica dilucide explicantur. Lugduni batavorum [Leiden] (Apud Cornelium Haak)
1743. Oct.(<em>Oratio peregrinat</em>.), (SO 1355, KR 132, STR 5606). <em>Orig. ed.</em> (n.v.): 1741, see KR, SO and STR 5613.

<em>Leiden ed</em>: 1743, p. [1]-28. <em>Copies</em>: HU(4), MO, M, US. – Issued with:
	A. Boberg, <em>Programma</em>, p. 29-36.

	<em>Schreb. ed.</em> 2, app. 2: 408-429. 1787.

	Academien i Upsala vid tilfälle af en promotions act. då ... Johan Ẁestman 1743 ... af

4728. Q.F.F.Q.S. Disputationem botanico-medicam inauguralem, qua <em>Ficus</em>, ejusque

4730. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Systema naturae</em> in quo proponuntur natura regia tria secundum
classes, ordines, genera &amp; species. Editio quarta ab auctore emendata &amp; aucta. Accesserunt
nomina gallica ... Parisiis (Sumptibus Michaelis-Antonii David, ...) 1744. Oct. (<em>Syst. nat.

<em>Editors</em>: Abraham Bäck (1713-1795), Bernard de Jussieu (1699-1777).
<em>Publ</em>.: 1744, p. [i*], [i]-xxvi, [1]-108, [1, priv.], <em>pl. clavis class. Copies</em>: G, MO. – Essentially a
	French edition, with French vernacular names, of ed. 2. Usually accompanied by <em>Fund.
	bot.</em> ed. 2 (1740).

4731. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Flora svecica</em> [suecica] exhibens plantas per regnum Sveciae
crescentes, systematice cum differentiis specierum synonymis autorum nominibus incola-
rum solo locorum usu pharmacopaeorum. Stockholmiae (Sumtu &amp; literis Laurentii Salvii)
1745. Oct. (<em>Fl. suec.</em>), (SO 407, KR 17, STR 5339). 

<em>Orig. ed</em>.: Summer 1745, p. [i*-iv*], [i]-xii, [xiii-xvi], 1-419, [420, err.], <em>1 pl</em>. (uncol. copp.).
	<em>Copies</em>: G, HU, MO, US; IDC 179. – The plate represents <em>Linnaea borealis</em>. – See also HU
	523.

4752. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Amoenitates academici</em>, seu dissertationes variae physicae, medicae,
botanicae antehac seorsim editae nunc collectae et auctae cum tabulis aeneis, accedit
hypothesis nova de febrium intermittentium causa. Volumen primum. Lugduni Bata-
vorum [Leiden] (apud Cornelium Haak) 1749. Oct.† (<em>Amoen. acad., Camper ed.</em>). (SO 1279,
KR 168, STR 4673). 

<em>Editor</em>: Peter Camper (1722-1789), see TL-2/1: 430.
<em>Publ</em>: 1749, p. [i-vi], [1]-610, [1-9], <em>15 pl. Copies</em>: MO(2), US, USDA. – page 176 misnumbe-
	red 164. This edition remained unfinished; see SO 1279 for further details.
<em>Note</em>: For a general note on the <em>Amoenitates</em> and the Linnaean dissertations see below, <em>Amoen.
	acad.</em>, [Linnaeus edition] 1749-1769.

4753. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Amoenitates academicae</em> seu dissertationes variae physicae, medicae
botanicae antehac seorsim editae nunc collectae et auctae cum tabulis aeneis ... Holmiae
[Stockholm] et Lipsiae [Leipzig] (apud Godofredum Kiesewetter) 1749[-1769], 7 vols.
Oct. (<em>Amoen. acad.</em>) [Linnaeus edition] (SO 1200, KR 168, STR 4674). 

<em>Note</em>: For the involved bibliography of the various series and editions see Soulsby. The
<em>Amoenitates</em> are reprints of the Linnaean dissertations. For purposes of plant taxonomy and
nomenclature it will usually be necessary to consult the original dissertations rather than
the reprints in the <em>Amoenitates</em> since quite a few changes and additions occur. For a discussion
of the authorship of the Linnaean dissertations see Stearn 1957 (pp. 51-64) who reprints
also Lidén's list of dissertations (1778) and who cites the main studies on the dissertations
and amoenitates. Krok (Bibl. bot. suecana p. 460-461) gives a list of the Linnaean
dissertations which were certainly or probably written by the respondents themselves.
Rickett (1955) and Stearn (1957) come to the following important conclusion: "ascription
of a name to an authority, is, after all, a convention, its object being to clarify the
application of the name"; and for convenience, as well as for historical reasons, the <em>names first
published in the Linnaean dissertations</em>, in the original theses no less than in the amended
<em>Amoenitates academicae</em> versions, <em>should be attributed to Linnaeus</em> and to him alone." In our
treatment we follow Krok's attributions because in most cases he bases them on the
appearance of the designation "auctor" on the t.p. or elsewhere in the publication, clearly
pointing to the <em>defendens</em>. The great majority of the Linnaean dissertations must, as Stearn
and Rickett state, be attributed to Linnaeus himself.

<em>1</em>: autumn 1749, p. [i-iv], [1]-563, <em>pl. 1-17</em> (uncol. copp.). Copy: MO. – SO 1282.

4754. Caroli a Linné ... <em>Amoenitates academicae</em> seu dissertationes variae physicae, medicae
botanicae antehac seorsim editae nunc collectae et auctae cum tabulis aeneis. Volumen
primum [-decimum]. Editio tertia [c.q. secunda] curante D. Jo. Christiano Daniele
Schrebero ... Erlangae (sumtu Jo. Jacobi Palm) [1785-]1787 [-1790]. Oct. (<em>Amoen. acad.,

4760. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Philosophia botanica</em> in qua explicantur fundamenta botanica cum
definitionibus partium, exemplis terminorum, observationibus rariorum, adjectis figuris
aeneis. Cum privilegio. Stockholmiae, (Apud Godofr. Kiescwetter) 1751. Oct. (<em>Philos.
bol.</em>). (SO 437, KR 138, STR 5669). 

1. <em>Orig. ed</em>.: Dec 1750, p. [i-vi], [1]-362, <em>pl. 1-9</em> (<em>pl. 10</em>= p. 307, <em>pl. 11</em> = p. 309) (uncol. copp. I.
	G. Hallman del.). <em>Copies</em>: FH, HH, HU, MO, NY, U-V, US(2), USDA. – SO 437
	mentions a portrait in some copies; this is the portrait by J. M. Bernigeroth, Leipzig 1749
	which was e.g. also included in Syst. nat. ed. 7. None of the copies seen by us had this
	portrait. – The <em>Philosophia bolanica</em> is essentially an elaboration of the <em>Fundamenta botanica
	</em>of 1736 with some inclusions from the <em>Oratio de telluris habitabilis incremento</em> (1744) and the
	<em>Sponsalia plantarum</em>. Soulsby (no. 441) states that its substance formed the subject of
	Linnaeus's botanical lectures for 1746-1 748. – An English translation "The Elements of
	botany" was published by Hugh Rose, London 1775 (SO 4707); an authoritative French
	translation was published by Fr. A. Quesné: "Philosophie botanique de Charles Linné",
	Rouen 1788, (see below).–For further editions and secondary references see Krok 138
	and Soulsby 437a-478; an extensive commentary is given by Dahlgren. – For a recent
	detailed analysis of the <em>Philosophia</em> and its relation with Linnaeus's other work see F. A.
	Stafleu, <em>Linnaeus and the Linnaeans</em>, p. 25-78; for a bibliographical analysis see DuRietz
	(1965), Guèdes (1968, 1969) and HU 541.
2. <em>Stockholm/Amsterdam variant</em>: 1751, differs only in the imprint: Stockholmiae (Godofr.
	Kiesewetter), Amstelodami (apud Z. Chatelain). <em>Copy</em>: n.v. – This variant, which seems
	to be much rarer than the Stockholm issue shows no essential differences. (See DuRietz,
	1965, and Guèdes 1968, 1969).–STR 5670.
3. <em>Reprint</em>: 1755, p. [i-iv], [1]-364, <em>pl. 1-9</em> (<em>10 &amp; 11</em> in text). <em>Copies</em>: M, MO, USDA. – SO 442,
	STR 5673 – Viennae Austriae [Wien] (typis Joannis Thomae Trattner, ...) 1755. Oct.
4. <em>Facsimile ed., first issue</em>: Dec 1966, colophon on p. 2 of cover, p. [i-vi], [1]-362, <em>pl. 1-9</em> (<em>10</em> and
	<em>11</em> in text). <em>Copy</em>: FAS. – 100 numbered copies printed "greeting the New Year of 1967"
	by J. Gramer in Lehre. This reproduces the variant no-2. – STR 5671.
5. <em>Facsimile ed., second issue</em>: 1966 (i. e. 1967), p. [i*-iv*], [i-vi], [1]-362, <em>pl. 1-9</em> (<em>10</em> and <em>11</em> in
	text). <em>Copies</em>: FAS, U.– "C. Linnaeus. <em>Philosophia botanica</em>... Reprint 1966 by J. Cramer,
	3301 Lehre ...," Historiae naturalis classica tomus xlviii. ISBN 3-7682-0350-6. – STR
	5672.
6. <em>Editio altera</em>: 1763, p. [1]-368, <em>pl. 1-9</em> (<em>10</em> and <em>11</em> in text). <em>Copies</em>: M, MO, USDA. – SO 443,
	STR 5674 (Soulsby mentions a portrait; not present in the copies seen by us.– "... figuris
	aeneis. Editio altera. Viennae Austriae [Wien]," (typis Joannis Thomae Trattner, ...)
	1763, Oct. – Soulsby (no. 443) mentions a variant with 3 extra unnumbered plates and
	"Typis J. T. Trattner" not seen by us. – This editio altera is essentially another reprint of
	ed. 1.
7. <em>Editio secunda</em>: 1780, p. [ii*: portr. Linn., iii* t.p.], [i-iv], [1]-362, <em>pl. 1-11</em> (uncol. copp.).
	<em>Copies</em>: FAS, M, MO, U, US, USDA. – SO 445, STR 5676.– "Caroli Linnaei ...
	Philosophia botanica ... figuris aeneis. Editio secunda in gratiam botanophilorum revisa
	et emendata. Curante D. Johanne Gottlieb Gleditsch [1744-1786, see TL-2/1: 951-952].
	Berolini [Berlin] (impensis Christiani Friderici Himburgi) 1780. Oct.
8. <em>Editio secunda</em> [Wien]: 1783, p. [i-vi], [1]-360, <em>pl. 1-10</em> (<em>pl. 11</em>= p. 307). <em>Copy</em>: MO. – STR
	5677. – " ... aeneis. Editio secunda ... Viennae [Wien], typis Joannis Thomae nobil. de
	Trattner, ... ) 1783. Oct.
9. <em>Editio quarta</em>: 1787, in J. E. Gilibert, ed., <em>Systema plantarum Europae</em>, vol. 3, 1787, p. [i*-iv*],
	i-xxxii, [1]-304, 307, 308, 308*, 309*, 309-362, <em>pl. 1-23</em>, [i, iii, v], 363-552, 555-594, [1-4,
	err.]. <em>Copy</em>: MO. – SO 447/448, STR 5678.– "Caroli Linnaei ... Philosophia botanica,
	... aeneis. Editio quarta 1787" (no imprint).
10. <em>Editio quarta, Genève variant</em>: 1787, in id., [i*-iv*], [1-4, err.], i-xxxii, [i-iv], [1]-307, 308,
	308*, 309*, 309-362, <em>pl. 1-13</em>, [1], 363-552, 555-594. <em>Copy</em>: MO. – STR 5679. – "...
	aeneis. Cui accedit Critica botanica. Editio quarta. Coloniae-Allobrogum [Genève],
	(sumptibus Piestre &amp; Delamollière) 1787. Oct. – Edited by J. E. Gilibert; see SO 448.

PAGE: 91
HEADING: LINNAEUS (1751)

11. <em>Editio tertia</em> [sic] <em>aucta et emendata</em> cura Caroli Ludovici Willdenow, ... Berolini (impensis
	Christiani Friderici Himburgi) 1790. – See under C. L. Willdenow. Contains so many
	changes that it should be attributed to the editor. – SO 449, STR 5681.
12. <em>Madrid edition</em>: 1792, "... Philosophia botanica, annotationibus, explanationibus,
	supplementis aucta cura, et opera Casimiri Gomez Ortega, ... Matriti (... viduae, et
	filii Petri Marin.) 1792. – See under C. G. Ortega (TL-2/7113). SO 450, STR 5682.
13. <em>Editio quarta</em>: 1809, "... Philosophia botanica, ... aeneis. Editio quarta studio Curtii
	Sprengel. Halae ad Salam [Halle a. S.] (sumtibus Car. Aug. Kümmel) 1809. – See under
	K. P. J. Sprengel. – SO 451, STR 5683.
14. <em>Editio aucta et emendata</em>: 1824, "... Philosophia botanica, in qua explicantur botanices
	fundamenta, studio Curtii Sprengel; editio aucta et emendata ... Tornaci nerviorum
	[Tournay, Doornik] (e typis Caroli Casterman-Dien) 1824. – See under K. P. J.
	Sprengel. – SO 452, STR 5684. – According to Tournay (1953) this edition was
	published by J. G. S. van Breda (1788-1867).
15. <em>English translation</em>: 1775, p. [i]-xii, [1]-472, <em>pl. 1-11</em>, app. <em>1-3. Copy</em>: MO. – SO 470, STR
	5308. – <em>The elements of botany</em>: ... being a translation of the Philosophia botanica, ... to
	which is added an appendix, wherein are described some plants lately found in Norfolk
	and Suffolk, ... by Hugh Rose [c. 1717-1792], ... London (Printed for T. Cadell, ...)
	1775. Oct. See under H. Rose for further details. For another partial translation see
	James Lee, <em>Intr. bot.</em> 1760, TL-2/4289, SO 453.
16. <em>Spanish translation</em>: see A. Palau y Verdèra ... parte theorica, 1778. – SO 471, STR 7241.
17. <em>German translation</em>: 1787, p. [1]-93. <em>Copy</em>: MO. – SO 472. – <em>Pflanzenphilosophie im Auszuge</em>,
	nach Linné's Methode ... Augsburg (in der Joseph-Wolffischen Buchhandlung) 1787.
	Oct. – Anonymous.
18. <em>French translation</em>: 1788, p. [i]-iv, [1]-456, [1-3, priv.; 4, err.], <em>pl. 1-11. Copies</em>: G, MO,
	Verdoorn, USDA. – SO 473, STR 5680. – <em>Philosophie botanique</em> de Charles Linné, ... dans
	laquelle sont expliqués les fondements de la botanique avec les définitions de ses parties,
	les exemples des termes, des observations sur les plus rares. Enrichie de figures. Traduite
	du Latin par Fr.-A. Quesné [François Alexandre Quesné (1752-1820)] ... A Paris (chez
	Cailleau, ... chez Leboucher le jeune, ... ) 1788. Oct. (in fours). – Privilège dated 16 Mai
	1788.
19. <em>Russian translation</em>: 1800, Filosofija botaniki ... Sankt peterburge, n.v., see SO 475.
<em>Ref</em>.: Dahlgren, K.V.O., Sv. Linné-Sällsk. Årsskr. 33-34: 1-30. 1951.
	DuRietz, R., Sv. Linné-Sällsk. Årsskr. 48: 60-87. 1965 (analytical bibliographical detail;
	collation).
	Guédès, M., J. Soc. Bibl. nat. Hist. 4(7): 385-389. 1968, 5(2): 116. 1969.
	Stafleu, F. A., Linnaeus and the Linnaeans, Utrecht 1971.

4761. D. D. Dissertatio botanica qua <em>Nova plantarum genera</em> suffrag. amp. et experient. Fac.
med. in illustri Acad. Upsaliensi, sub praesidio, ... Caroli Linnaei, ... publice proponit
Leonhard Joh. Chenon, Vermelandus. In Aud. Carol. maj. ad. diem. xix Oct. anni mdccli
horis ante meridiem solitis. Upsaliae [1751]. Qu. (<em>Nova pl. gen. II</em>). (SO 1627, KR 4b, STR
5103). 

<em>Publ</em>.: 19 Oct 1751, p. [i], [1]-47, [48]. <em>Copies</em>: MO(2). – Further eds.: SO 1628-1631, e.g.
	<em>Amoen. acad.</em> 3(31): 1-27. 1756; <em>Amoen. acad. Schreber ed.</em> 3(31): 1-27. 1787. – For <em>Nova pl.
	gen. I</em> see above TL-2/4771, 1747.

4765. D.D. Dissertatio medico botanica, sistens <em>Rhabarbarum</em>, quam consensu experient.

4766. A.D.D.O.M. Questio historico naturalis, <em>Cui bono?</em> Quam breviter solutam, consensu

	1787.
<em>Ref</em>.: Kiesenwetter, E. A. H. von, S.B. Isis 1872: 43-55.

4767. Caroli Linnaei ... <em>Genera plantarum</em> eorumque characteres naturales secundum
numerum, figuram, situm, et proportionem omnium fructificationes partium quae novis
lxx celeb. auctoris generibus sparsim editis locupletata, in usum auditorii recudenda
curavit Christoph. Carolus Strumpff ... Editio quarta. Halae magdeburgicae [Halle a.S.]
(Apud Carol. Christ. Kümmel) 1752. Oct. (<em>Gen. pl. ed. 4</em>). (SO 300, KR 2, STR 5379).

<em>Ref</em>.: Bryk, F., Taxon 3: 178. 1954.

4768. Herr Archiaterns och Riddarens D. Caroli Linnaei <em>Indelning i Ört-Riket</em>, efter Syste-
ma naturae, på Swenska öfwersatt af Johan J. Haartman, ... Stockholm (trykt hos Lars
Salvius) 1753. Oct. (<em>Indeln. Ört-Riket</em>), (<em>Syst. nat. ed.</em> [<em>8</em>], <em>regn. veg.</em>), (SO 53, STR 5420).

	Sheets B-E. copied from 1753 ed.
